alert.note: Alert for Appomattox; Buckingham; Charlotte (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 10:43PM EDT until July 16 at 4:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Appomattox County in central Virginia... Buckingham County in central Virginia... Northern Charlotte County in south central Virginia... * Until 445 AM EDT Sunday. * At 1043 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Buckingham... Appomattox... Dillwyn... Bent Creek... Pamplin City... Toga... Andersonville... This includes the following streams and drainages... Bear Branch, Abbott Branch, Beasley Creek, Bear Garden Creek, Bear Creek, Beaverpond Branch, Appomattox River and Alabama Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
